    public final class ServiceRef
extends java.lang.Object
implements Description, Injectable
    A reference to a web service.

    Chris Burdess

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServiceRef

        public ServiceRef()

    • Method Detail

      • setName

        public void setName​(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of this service reference. Corresponds to the service-ref-name element in the deployment descriptor.

        The name is relative to the java:comp/env context.

        Parameters:
        name - the service reference name
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 14.4.8: Web Service References

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of this service reference.
        Returns:
        the service reference name

      • setServiceInterface

        public void setServiceInterface​(java.lang.String serviceInterface)
        Sets the service interface class. Corresponds to the service-interface element in the deployment descriptor.

        This is the fully-qualified class name of the JAX-WS Service class (either generated or javax.xml.ws.Service).

        Parameters:
        serviceInterface - the service interface class name
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 14.4.8: Web Service References

      • setClassName

        public void setClassName​(java.lang.String className)
        Sets the service endpoint interface class or generated service class. Corresponds to the service-ref-type element in the deployment descriptor.

        This is the fully-qualified class name that the injected reference should be assignable to.

        Parameters:
        className - the service reference type class name
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 14.4.8: Web Service References

      • setWsdlFile

        public void setWsdlFile​(java.lang.String wsdlFile)
        Sets the location of the WSDL file. Corresponds to the wsdl-file element in the deployment descriptor.

        This is a path relative to the module root. The WSDL file is required unless the service is a generated SEI.

        Parameters:
        wsdlFile - the WSDL file path relative to the module root
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 14.4.8: Web Service References

      • setJaxrpcMappingFile

        public void setJaxrpcMappingFile​(java.lang.String jaxrpcMappingFile)
        Sets the location of the JAX-RPC mapping file. Corresponds to the jaxrpc-mapping-file element in the deployment descriptor.

        This is a path relative to the module root. Only used with JAX-RPC style web services (deprecated in favour of JAX-WS).

        Parameters:
        jaxrpcMappingFile - the JAX-RPC mapping file path
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 14.4.8: Web Service References

      • setServiceQname

        public void setServiceQname​(java.lang.String serviceQname)
        Sets the qualified name of the service. Corresponds to the service-qname element in the deployment descriptor.

        This is the fully qualified QName of the service as declared in the WSDL.

        Parameters:
        serviceQname - the service QName as a string
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 14.4.8: Web Service References

      • setPortComponentRef

        public void setPortComponentRef​(java.lang.String portComponentRef)
        Sets a reference to a port component. Corresponds to the port-component-ref element in the deployment descriptor.

        This allows customization of the port and its configuration.

        Parameters:
        portComponentRef - the port component reference
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 14.4.8: Web Service References

      • setHandler

        public void setHandler​(java.lang.Object handler)
        Sets a handler for this service reference. Corresponds to the handler element in the deployment descriptor.

        Handlers are invoked before and after the service endpoint is invoked.

        Parameters:
        handler - the handler definition
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 14.4.8: Web Service References

        public void init​(javax.xml.ws.WebServiceRef config)
